title: General election: Cost of living help among voters' pleas
description: With a general election looming, voters in a key Welsh battleground have highlighted the cost of living as one of the key issues. Tara Mellor from Geek's Barbers says she is "working extra hours, trying to cut back, doing meal plans, turning the heating down, but it doesn't seem to be making much of an impact".

title: DAILY MAIL COMMENT: Another open door to illegal migration
description: While all eyes are on asylum seekers crossing the Channel, thousands more migrants may be entering Britain because of criminally lax security at some airports.

description: Nick Boles, who quit Conservatives over ‘refusal to compromise’ on Brexit, is helping Sir Keir Starmer’s party prepare for government

title: Flip-flopping Labour commits humiliating policy U-turn in just 12 hours

title: Former minister Tobias Ellwood calls for new legislation to stop protesters visiting MPs' houses
description: An MP has called for new legislation to stop protesters visiting MPs' houses following reports that Just Stop Oil plans to occupy politicians' homes ahead of the next general election.

description: This comes after the Scottish Labour Party's conference passed a motion calling for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza.

title: Keir Starmer’s weakness could soon be exposed again
description: Several shadow ministers have been heard using the formulation that Labour would “ban ‘exploitative’ zero-hours contracts”, which suggests that “non-exploitative’” zero-hours contracts will continue, despite the fact that many workers and trade unions see them as inherently exploitative.

title: Donald Trump breaks silence on Alexei Navalny's death - but makes no mention of Vladimir Putin
description: Several world leaders, including US President Joe Biden, have directly blamed the Russian government for the death of the prominent Kremlin critic.

title: Tories move forward with ban on overseas care workers bringing family to the UK
description: TORY plans to ban overseas care workers from bringing family members to the UK have been described as “populist idiocy”.

description: Faith in the government over a series of scandals is “hanging by a thread”, the shadow business secretary says.

title: Yousaf joins big oil to slam Scottish Labour's windfall tax plans
description: FIRST MINISTER Humza Yousaf branded Labour a “wolf in a red rosette” today as he took the side of oil and gas executives in slamming the party’s tax plans.

title: Keir Starmer under growing pressure to back immediate Gaza ceasefire as Momentum launches campaign
description: Exclusive: The left-wing campaigning group is preparing for a ‘lobbying blitz’ to put pressure on MPs to back the SNP’s call for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza

title: Triple lock pension set to be Labour manifesto commitment
description: Labour will commit to the future of the triple lock on the state pension in its general election manifesto, i understands. The party is set to confirm that if it is elected, it will continue to increase the state pension each year by the same level as inflation, average earnings growth or 2.5 per cent – whichever is highest.

title: Keir Starmer's Glasgow speech said more about Labour policy
description: Sir Keir Starmer, in his speech on Sunday in Glasgow, acknowledged that positive polling is not enough to rely on. He acknowledged that - however unlikely - the possibility of a Conservative win at the next General Glection cannot and should not be ruled out.

title: Labour backtracks over Sue Gray’s announcement on citizen assemblies that will bypass Whitehall
description: Labour has backtracked on plans to create dozens of citizens’ assemblies to deliberate on new laws following a backlash against the “stupid idea”. Sue Gray, the party’s chief of staff, had said in an interview that she would introduce the measure as part of efforts to devolve power from Whitehall.
